alert.note: Alert for Autauga (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 7:19PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Autauga. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 719 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over a short period of time. Additional rainfall is expected as storms move over the same area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prattville, Millbrook, Marbury and New Prospect.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
